column3: Can you redo this pull request, and delete the *.mo files please?  Thanks.\n
I removed mo now, why do it need to be removed?\n

Please rebase your commits, rather than add a new one.  We do not want to add two commits to the bitcoin history, one undoing 50% of the last commit :)

Why remove *.mo?  It is a binary file, impossible to review.  Your *.po could be correct, but an attacker may rewrite *.mo to add their own messages.

I hope it is right now, In my fork repo I used 

```
git reset --hard HEAD@{2}
```

and commited, then

```
git push -f
```
